Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: glazed black; row of dots in added white below rim; band of tongues in added red and white outline; exterior: part of palmette.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd was burnt during the bombings in London in 194 For parallels regarding the interior and exterior decoration, see Lemos no. 1075 from Tocra.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 88)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 308, no. 1269, pl. 162, no. 1269)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2009) (phase 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: UCL n.p. 68 (Other Accession Number)
